review: It works well enough for Netflix and Vudu, but not at all for Amazon Instant Video, which is one of the services I have and use the most, being a prime member.  Chromecast doesn't support Amazon Instant Video and the only way to make it work at all, is to cast your desktop screen onto your TV, which can be done, but it's more-or-less in BETA form and when I start the Amazon Instant Video player, it is supper choppy.  I have very fast, high speed, cable internet service, but it seems like the Chromecast just can't process the stream fast enough.  Super choppy, super sucky!  I'm going to try the Fire stick from Amazon next, which claims to have a multi-core processor and double the memory on it.  We'll see!  It's $4 more than the Chromecast, so the prices are comparable.  I just wish I could return the Chromecast!
